q: You are working on a project using Git as version control. Which of the following commands will you use to join two or more development histories together?
You are working on a project using Git as version control. Which of the following commands will you use to switch its branch and work on a different branch?

You are working on a project using Git. You want to stash some changes that you have made in your project. Which of the following statements about git-stash are correct:

  1. It is used for undoing changes to a repository's commit history.
  2. It saves local modifications away and reverts the working directory to match the HEAD commit.
  3. The latest stash created is stored in refs/stash.
  4. It removes a commit from the project history.

You are working on a project using Git. You want to undo some of the changes. Which of the following statements about the git revert command are correct:

Statements

  1. It is used to revert changes to a repository's commit history.
  2. It prevents git from losing history.
  3. It moves the HEAD and branch ref pointers to a specified commit.
  4. It removes a commit from the project history.

You are working on a project using Git. You want to find the history of specific code added to a repository using the git blame command. Which of the following statements about git blame are correct:

  1. It only operates on individual files.
  2. It is used to examine the state of the repository.
  3. It is a versatile troubleshooting utility.
  4. The -e option shows the author's username.

You are working on a repository in Git. Which of the following commands will you use to examine specific points of a file's history and get the context such as the last author who has modified a line?

You are working on multiple Git repositories. You want to move a full repository from one remote server to another. The steps to copy everything from the original repository to the new repository are provided. Which of the following workflow of the steps is correct?

Steps

  1. Create a local repository in the temp-dir directory and copy the entire original repository. 
    git clone --mirror <URL to Original repository> temp-dir
  2. Push all your branches and tags. 
    git push origin --all
git push --tags

  3. Clear the link to the original repository.

    git remote rm origin

  4. Link your local repository to your newly created repository.

    git remote add origin <URL to New repository>

You are working on a project using Git and you want to move a file from source to destination. Which of the following statements are correct about the git-mv command:

  1. The git-mv can only move a file, a directory, or a symlink.
  2. The index is updated before moving the file.
  3. It updates the index for both old and new paths automatically.
  4. The --force force moves a file even if the target does not exist.
You are working on a project using Git. Which of the following commands will you use to remove all .txt files from the directory called dir and its sub-directories?
You are working on a project in Git. Which of the following commands will you use to view the changes you have made in your working tree relative to the commit called Hacker?
You are working on a project using Git as version control. If you are reviewing the project and want to display the full difference of each commit, then which of the following commands will you use?
You are working on a project and using Git as version control. Which of the following commands will you use to push all the local branches to a specified remote repository?

You are working on a project using Git as version control. Which of the following commands will you use to create a new commit that reverts all the changes made and then applies it to the current branch?
You are working on a remote repository using Git. Which of the following commands will you use to fetch the specified remote's copy of the current branch and immediately merge it into the local copy?
You are working on a project using Git. Which of the following will you use to download all the objects and references from a specific project repository?

You are working on a project in Git. If you want to integrate changes from one branch to another branch, then which of these following statements are correct:

  1. You can use git-rebase and git-merge both.

  2. git-rebase is a non-destructive operation.

  3. git-merge is a destructive operation.

  4. You can use the git merge main command.

  5. You can use the git rebase main command.

You are working on a command line utility in Git. You want to view expanded details of git objects and got to know about the git-show command. Which of these following statements are correct about the command:

  1. It shows only one type of object.
  2. The git-show command has a specific behavior per object type.
  3. It presents the merge commit in a different format.
  4. By default, the git-show command acts against the TAGS reference.

You are working on a project and using Git for version control. You want to add all the file contents to the index. Which of the following command will you use for staging all the changes on the project?
You are working on a project and using git for version control. Which of the following commands will you use to check a limited number of commits on the project?

You are working on git attributes. If you want to write git attributes, then which of the following statements are correct:

  1. The gitattributes file is a text file that gives attributes to a pathname.
  2. Lines that begin with '//' are ignored.
  3. Each line in the gitattributes file is of the "pattern atrib1-atrib2-atrib3-atrib4...." form.
  4. The gitattributes directory is $GIT_DIR/info/attributes.

You are working on hooks in Git. If you want to customize git's internal behavior and want to know more about hooks used by git, then which of these following statements are correct:

  1. Hooks are programs that you can place in a hooks directory to trigger actions at certain points in git’s execution.
  2. By default, the hook directory is $GIT_DIR/info/hooks.
  3. The pre-commit hook is invoked by the git-am command.
  4. Hooks that do not contain the executable bit set are ignored.

You are working on administrations in Git. Which of the following statements is correct about the git-fsck command:

  1. It verifies the connectivity and validity of the objects in the database.
  2. It cleans up unnecessary files and optimizes the local repository.
  3. It tests the SHA-1 function and general object sanity.
  4. It accepts any of the options accepted by the git-log command.

You are working on Administrations in Git. You want to perform cleaning and get to know about the git-clean command. If you are required to implement the command, then which of the following statements are correct about the command:

Statements

  1. It cleans up unnecessary files and optimizes the repository.
  2. It removes untracked files from the working tree.
  3. Generally, it removes only unknown files.
  4. It does not clean directories.
  5. It is useful to remove all built products.
  6. If <path> is provided, then only those paths are not affected.

You are working on a server in Git and you want to put your repository on a server and set up some protocols. Assuming that the server name is git.hacker.com and hack/git exists in the server and you want to set up your repository here. Which of the following commands will you use:

  1. cp -r project.git user@git.hacker.com:/hack/git
  2. scp -r project.git user@git.hacker.com:/hack/git
  3. cp -r project.git git.hacker.com:/hack/git
  4. scp -r project.git git.hacker.com:/hack/git
You are working on a remote repository in Git. Which of the following commands will you use to find all the information about a particular remote?

You are working on filter-branch in Git. If you want to check each commit in the original repository, then which of the following statements are correct about the git-filter-branch command:

  1. It can be used to remove a subset of files.
  2. It is suited for read-only updates.
  3. It can be used to remove a file from all commits.
  4. The performance of this command is slow.
  5. This operation is very I/O expensive.
  6. It waits for a connection to ask for a service and serves that service if it is enabled.

You are working on a project using Git. If you want to transfer data between two repositories, then which of the following protocols will you use:

  1. Dumb 
  2. Local 
  3. SSH 
  4. Smart
You are working on a project using Git. You want to make changes to the project but do not want the changes to impact the rest of the team's work. Where should you implement these changes?
In Git, you have stored some content in a repository. Git provides a unique key that can be used to access the content. Which of the following contains the key?
Mike is working on Git. He wants to reset the staging area and work the directory to match the most recent commit. Then in this scenario, which of the following command can he can use?

Which of these statements about the following Git commands is correct:

  1. Command 1: git reset --soft HEAD~1
  2. Command 2: git reset --hard HEAD~1

a.option: Command 1 deletes the most recent commit by saving all the changes that you have made
Command 2 deletes the most recent commit by saving all the changes that you have made
Command 1 deletes the most recent commit by not saving the changes that you have made
Command 2 deletes the most recent commit by not saving all the changes that you have made

q:
What is the function of the following Git code:

$ git commit -m "Some message"
$ git reset --soft HEAD~
<< edit files as necessary >>
$ git add ...
$ git commit -c ORIG_HEAD

a.option: Reverting a commit and committing again

q:
Which of these codes is used to perform the same operation that is performed by the following code in a simpler manner by implementing the git stash command:

"$ git checkout -b my_wip
$ git commit -a -m ""WIP""
$ git checkout master
$ edit emergency fix
$ git commit -a -m ""Emergency""
$ git checkout my_wip
$ git reset --soft HEAD^"

a.option:
$ git stash
$ edit emergency fix
$ git commit -a -m "Emergency"
$ git stash push

"$ git stash emergency fix
$ git commit -l "Emergency"
$ git stash pop"

$ git stash
$ edit emergency fix
$ git commit -a -m "Emergency"
$ git stash pop

"$ git stash master "emergency fix"
$ git cache-diff -p ""Emergency""
$ git stash pop"

q:
If you are implementing the git rev-parse command, then you can use this option to echo certain data:

--keep-dashdash

Which of the following operations is used to implement the command?

Which of these Git commands is used to replace the following command for all use cases:

git push origin HEAD:refs/for/master

Your project contains a repository that must be cloned into a newly created repository. To clone this repository, you have used the git clone command that creates branches that can be remotely tracked. If you are required to update these branches after cloning the repository, then which of the following commands will you use?

a.option: Use a the git fetch command without arguments
Use the git fetch command with arguments
Use the git pull command without arguments
Use the git pull command with arguments

q: You are working on a Git project. You have replaced an encrypted string 'hello world' with its actual value. Now, you are required to determine the commit into all branches of your project in which the 'hello string' was introduced. Which of the following commands will you use to find the occurrence of this string?

You are working on a Git project. You have pushed certain files into a remote repository that contain some coding files and a single log file. Now, you are required to delete these log files from the remote repository but keeping it in the local filesystem. Which of the following commands will you use to perform this task?

You are working on a project that is hosted on the Github platform. There are many authors contributing to this project. Which of the following commands is used to determine the total number of commits performed by an author to each pathname of a file?

You have retrieved a project from the GitHub platform. You noticed a lot of activities and forks on your repository after a few days. If you want to know the exact fork from which you have pulled the project, then which of the following commands is used to determine the original URL from which your local repository has been cloned?

Consider that a user whose username is brent.doe uses the git push command to upload some new changes. These changes are made for the xyz branch of the example/abc project. This project is hosted at the git.ex.com Git server. Which of the following commands is suitable for this scenario?
Which of the following statements correctly justifies the migration of frameworks from Apache Subversion (SVN) to Git?

a.option: Git is a distributed version control while SVN is not
Creating branches is faster in SVN than Git but SVN offers limited number of steps to create branches

q: You are provided a list of files and have staged certain changes for the next commit. Which of the following Git commands is used to determine the summary of the files that contain these changes?
In Git, if you are executing the git pull origin master command, then where is the 'origin master' pointing to?

a.option: Master branch that is available in the local repository
Cached copy of the latest-recovered local master branch
Master branch that is available at a remote location
Cached copy of the latest-recovered master branch that is available at a remote location

q:
What is the function of the following Git commands:

  1. git reset --mixed HEAD
  2. git reset --hard HEAD

a.option:
1. Reverts to the last commit 
2. Removes all the added changes from an index

1. Removes all the added changes from an index 
2. Reverts to the last commit

1. Removes only some files from an index
2. Removes all the added changes from an index

1. Removes all the added changes from an index 
2. Removes only some files from an index

q: You are using an SSH connection for your AWS CodeCommit repository. If your task is to clone a CodeCommit repository to your local machine, then which of the following Git clone commands must be used?

You are required to use the git cherry-pick command on several commits. The working tree is clean. You cannot determine a way to apply certain changes. Which of the following represents the first step that the git cherry-pick command takes to resolve this problem?

a.option: The CHERRY_PICK_HEAD ref is set to point at the commit that introduced this change. It is ambiguous to apply.
The CHERRY_PICK_HEAD ref is set to skip the commit that introduced this change. It is ambiguous to apply.
The current branch and HEAD pointer must stay at the last successful commit.
Conflicting paths in the working tree are resolved.

q: Some Git commands take the combination of flags and parameters as the input. These flags and parameters are also used in the git rev-list command. Which of the following commands is used to distinguish between these flags and parameters?

In the following Git code, which of the following aliases can be used as an alternative:

git log -g --abbrev-commit --pretty=oneline
In Git, if you have committed your code with an incorrect commit message, then which of the following commands is used to correct the commit message?
In Git, which of the following statements about bare directories is correct?

a.option: It is an official copy of a repository.
It can be updated by applying the push command.
Its content can be retrieved by applying the clone or pull command to it.

q:
You have performed a clone operation by using the following command:

git clone math math.clone1

The clone operation is successfully executed. Which of these commands is used to determine the SHA1 ID and the first part of commit messages for each branch?
In Git, which of the following commands is used to limit the output of the git log command to only display commit operations with a commit message that contains the associated string?
In Git, which of the following represents that only the root TODO file can be ignored but not the subdir/TODO file in a .gitignore file?
In Git, which of the following statements about hooks is correct?

a.option: Hooks are scripts that can run automatically on the occurrence of an event in a repository.
Hooks are used to customize the internal behavior of the Git software.

q: In Git, which of the following commands is used to only overwrite the reference?
In Git, if postfix is synchronized with a remote branch, then it deletes only a remote branch. Which of the following postfixes is used to ensure that you do not lose data?
In Git, which of the following commands is used to rename the current branch to renamed_branch?
In Git, which of the following statements about the .gitignore file is correct?

a.option: The .gitignore file is added to the root directory of the repository.
The .gitignore file allows you to add items and commit these items.

q: You have uploaded a project on the Git platform. Now, you have made some changes in some files of the project. In one step, you want these modified files to be automatically detected, added to an index, and committed. Which of the following commands will you use to perform the mentioned function?

In Git, what is the function of the following command:

$ git mv file_from file_to

a.option: It is used to move a file into the same directory
It is used to move the head of the branch
It is used to rename a file
It is used to create a read-only copy of a file

q: You have stored the changes made to a file in the benchmarks.rb file. Which of the following Git commands is used to undo the changes?
You are required to use the git blame command. Which of the following Git commands is used to restrict the application of the blame annotation to a limited set of lines?
Your task is to ensure that merge operations occur only if the current HEAD branch is updated. Which of the following Git options must be used to attain your task?
You have extracted code from the AWS CodeCommit repository to your local repository. If you want to push these changes to a different location, then which of the following Git commands must be used?

You are configuring the submodule.<name>.update key in your .gitmodules file for your Git project. Which of the following parameters are you allowed to use in this case:

  1. Checkout
  2. Rebase
  3. Merge
  4. Clone

In Git, which of the following commands is used to:

  1. Automatically merge commit operations without being reviewed by the users.
  2. Store commit operations in a local repository and does not merge them with the current branch.
In Git, if you have applied the git commit -a command without the name of a file, then which of the following statements is correct?

a.option: Commits only those files that contain the most number of additions or deletions

q:
You have created a new Git directory and performed the first commit operation by using the git commit -m "First Commit" command. What is the significance of the b6bd481 string that is available in the second line of the following code:

SMA:my_git_project donny$ git commit -m "First Commit"
[master (root-commit) b6bd481] First Commit
3 files changed, 3 insertions(+)
create mode 100644 my_file
create mode 100644 myfile2
create mode 100644 myfile3

a.option: It denotes a unique name that is allocated to the commit operation.
It denotes a randomly-generated string to show that the commit operation has been successfully performed.
It denotes a hash of the commit operation.

q: In Git, if you have integrated your development branch into the main branch, then which of the following commands is used to delete the branch?

What does the following git command do:

$ git clone https://github.com/seanseany/blockchain-cli
In Git, you have submitted a project for revision control. Which of the following Git commands is used to record contents of all the files under the current directory?

You are required to use the prefix option in Git to convert arguments into a command that is run in a subdirectory. Now, these arguments can also be used after they are moved to the top level of the repository. Which of these statements will you use to access these arguments at the top level of the repository?

a.option:
prefix=$(git rev-parse --show-prefix)
cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel)"
# rev-parse provides the -- needed for 'set'
eval "set $(git rev-parse --sq --prefix "$prefix" -- "$@")"

prefix=$(git rev-parse --show-prefix-top)
# rev-parse provides the -- needed for 'set'
eval "put $(git rev-prefix --sq --prefix "$prefix" -- "$@")"

cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel)"
# rev-parse provides the -- needed for 'set'
set "fix $(git rev-parse-prefix --sq --prefix "$prefix" -- "$@")"

q: Your primary task is to use the merge base command in your Git project. If you are required to determine the best ancestors of all supplied commits for preparing an n-way merge, then which of the following mode of operation must be used to fulfill your requirement?

In Git, you are defining a .gitmodules file for your project. You are required to define the path that is related to the top-level directory of a tree. This tree allows you to check the submodule. Which of the following commands will you use to achieve this task?
You have used the git log command to review the history of your Git project. Which of the following information is not displayed after each commit operation?
